messages.message:
Build feedback - *Selection mode:*
• This feels like a great way to start off creating a brand new field!
• Though sometimes, the name and prompt it comes up with aren't great.  For instance, see SS1, where the description better describes all of Part 1, not quite line 1.
• When used on an existing field, this feature could make the prompting better or worse; it currently feels like a toss-up.
    ◦  I know these are early days with this feature and it'll likely get better, but even a more mature feature like `Enhance prompt` for Document reasoning sometimes (though rarely) makes things worse.
    ◦ So *feature request*: this has likely been discussed in UX design discussions, but some sort of undo or revert changes button would help save situations where someone doesn't think to copy their prompt/description before using a feature like this.  It'd also be helpful when manually trying different prompts to attempt improvement.
• Often the name of the field that it chooses isn't one that I would like.
    ◦ This gets into an overall distinction in Build that has bugged me: *often there's a naming convention for the fields to best provide consistency and compatibility with downstream systems, but usually that convention doesn't align with a name that makes for a good prompt to extract the intended data.*
        ▪︎ This issue isn't unique to this feature, but if I have an intended name for a field then use this feature, it'll likely rename the field to something unintended.
    ◦ The only workaround that I know of would be to then create a derived field with the intended name, and copy over the output.
        ▪︎ However, there is no way that I am aware of to make a field in Build a hidden field (the legacy Refiner method of using double underscores before a name gets rejected; see SS2), so then the output would feature 2 fields for this extracted data, 1 named as intended and 1 unintended.
    ◦ I recognize that the words used in a name is important to reliably prompting the model to extract the intended data, so if it is not already planned, here's another *feature request:* Add a way to specify a distinct name for organizational and output purposes that can be separate from the name used to prompt the model.
    ◦ Relatedly, another *feature request* if not already in the backlog: Add support to designate certain fields as hidden in Build.
